news_header: More than 40 people, mostly women, died when an illegal gold mine collapsed in Mali's Kayes region. The victims were searching for gold scraps in open-pit areas left by industrial miners.
news_original_title: Dozens killed in Mali illegal gold mine collapse
news_text: This incident is the second deadly mining accident in three weeks. Conflicting reports state that either 43 or 48 people were killed. Mali, a major gold producer, faces frequent mining accidents due to unregulated activities. The collapse occurred at an abandoned site previously operated by a Chinese company, amidst concerns over environmental pollution and debt obligations to China.
